text: (upbeat music)
♪ Hey ♪
(upbeat music)
♪ I want ♪
(upbeat music)
- Welcome to Business Builders.
Today, I'm thrilled to be joined
by Marcello LaRosa, CEO at Apromore,

a category leader in
process mining technology.
Welcome, Marcello.
- Thank you, Bill.
It's a pleasure to be here with you today.

- Well, how about we start
by, what is process mining?

What does it mean, and can
you provide a few examples
to help them understand?
- What process mining allows us to do

is see through the
walls of an organization

and understand how the
organization really works.

Imagine managing a loan
application in a bank,
that's a business process,

or handling a purchase
request at a retailer

or at a manufacturer,
that's another example.

How do we go about
improving our operations?
The starting point of process mining

is the digital footprint that
these business processes leave

on top of the systems, the
enterprise systems that are used
to perform these processes.

So we can clearly visualize
the end-to-end process,

from the time we submit
the loan application

all the way to the time we
approve and disburse the loan,
and that picture, that photography reality
then provides the starting point,
through process mining techniques,
to start analyzing the process

in order to identify
opportunities for improving it.
- Thank you for those very clear examples.

It's great to see Apromore
actually grow as a business.
I know you started with six people
in a lab at the university and have grown

to become a much larger
organization today.

I'd love to understand what
helped lead to that growth

and also what's leading to
growth in the industry as well.

- And what we've observed
with our customers
is a bit of a shift of thinking
from process mining as a one-off project,
hey, let me fix my procure-to-pay process,
my back office process

let me see how this process
mining technique works.
Let me do a pilot here and there,

to process mining becoming
a strategic capability
for the whole organization.

So setting up a center of
excellence in process mining
to offer process mining as a service
to the various business units.

We've had quite a lot of
traction with Apromore

because we realized that if
we want to keep process mining
top of mind, a boards-level topic,

we need to create a platform
that is very easy to use
and can allow an organization
to achieve their strategic objectives
in a short time to value.
So the whole idea behind Apromore

revolves around creating a
completely no-code platform.

Very easy to use, very
intuitive for business users.
- If you think about the cloud computing
and how it helped your journey,

how do you see cloud computing
help SaaS organizations
build and innovate at scale?

- As our customers' appetite
for process mining grew,

all of a sudden, we
had to deal with issues

like being able to analyze
very large amounts of data
and being scalable, being very secure,
having a disaster recovery plan
and a business continuity plan,

and having the technology
to basically demonstrate
that that plan could actually be executed

in a timely fashion, so
we had to make a decision.
Do we spend 80% of our time
on these non-functional requirements,
or do we flip this around?
But if we want to focus on innovation,
then we need to outsource the management

of the infrastructure,
so we took the decision
to use AWS as our infrastructure partner

to be able to leave in very
experienced hands the management
of those non-functional requirements.

But as we started using AWS
services deeper and deeper,
we started appreciating the level of depth

of the managed services,
the variety for big data,

for analysis, for ML, AI, for
security, for scalability,

and if you couple that
with the enterprise support
that we are benefiting from through AWS,

that allowed us, through
this partnership model,
to learn how to best use and configure
these various services

so that we could meet
our customer demands.

- And you talked quite a
bit about your customers.
How can AWS help you be a happy customer,

or even more importantly, help
you create happy customers?
- We are pursuing a vision of realizing

what we call AI-assisted
process optimization,

that is, the ability to use
of a range of AI techniques,

including generative AI,
to support our customers
not only in the analysis and testing
of the various improvement options,

but also in the
identification of the options
in the first place.
So we are partnering with AWS
to pilot some of these deep tech services
in order to achieve our product vision.
- Marcello, great advice,
and thank you for your time today
and the great insights that you've shared
with both myself and our viewers.
Thank you for joining us.
